content: a ‘I’, KI50.31-2 【a.. .aysä.. .tsīme】 '1 go’, to aysu, aysä.
‘not’, Av. a-, an-, IE Pok. 756ne. See s.vv. a-, and. i-, with 【āhvaraa- 】‘sour’; K 101-39 i’īsedai ‘not returning’.
‘not self’, Manj. 390, variant 29-14 【anätma】; Manj. 323【 a-uysānai】, abstract v 103, 19V3 【a-uysānetä】.
‘non-being’, K2, 135v3, = BS【 asatva-】, to 【uysnora-】.

‘unskilled.’, iv 3, 6-7 【u caṃdä va vāri star<ä> da<ṃ>di akalāśca hīri yuḍai 】‘and. as to how many are the shares, so unskilfully you have acted.’; iv 3.8-9 【ttadī <daṃdi> akalāścauñä ya】 ‘it was only through such lack of skill’. See 【kala-】 ‘excellent’.
‘unattached’, Bcd 48V2, BS 【asakta-】; Bcd 52r3, BS 【asanga-】, to 【kaṣṭa-】.
‘not thinking’, dyadic v 131, 56a1 【amañāmata ak’āmate jsa】.
‘inconceivable’, K 53.10.10, with 【agāṣṭa-, avāṣṭa-, āīṭa-】, to 【käṣ-: kāsṭa-’】, BS 【acintiya-】.
‘unproductive’, Sid. IV4, to【 kīra-】‘work’.
‘inconceivable’, SuvO. 36r6, BS 【acintya-】, to käṣ-.
‘unstruck’ v 145, 33v5, =BS 【aghatfita-, anāhata-】;Z 13.114 【akrīya-】, to 【kalj-】:【krīya-】 ‘to beat’.
‘shameless’, Ⅲ 123.52, BS 【nirlajja-】; abstr. 【akṣārmauña 】‘lack of shame’, Manj. 67 akṣārmauña apakṣarāttai, to 【kṣär-: kṣāḍa-】.
gen. plur. ‘shameless’, Ⅱ 106.122 (of BS 【pudgala-】 ‘individuals’).
‘unmoved’, K152.17; IV 23.9 【akham’ista-】, to 【hamīh-:hamista-】 ‘to change’, 【ahamista-】 ‘unchanged’.
‘ not moving ’, K 111.354 【akhauys(a)ma jsa】, see 【khoys-】.
‘unmoved’, Bcd 56v2, Bcd 55v1, BS 【adhṛṣya-】, with 【akhāṃṣṭa-, akhāṣṭa-】, Manj. 368 【akhvauṣṭa-】, to 【khoys-: khauṣṭa-】.
‘undisturbed’, SuvO. 4r4, BS 【akṣobhya-】, to【 khvīh-】 ‘to agitate’.
‘faultless’, Bcd 48r1, BS【 acchidra-】, to 【ggaṃjsa-】 ‘ defect’.
‘inconstant (?)’, epithet of lovers, 11 130b1【 agṣṭau brrau jsa īnīda 】‘ they act with violence towards the inconstant (?) lovers’, to 【akaṣṭa-】.
‘inconceivable’, K 5, 144v1, with【 akāṣṭa-】; abstract K 6, 144v4 【agāṣṭatetu】.

‘unpolluted’, K 152.10 【jñāna-pārāma. . .vasva adū agūm pā’ darma-vajrrą,】 ‘the knowledge-perfection pure, undimmed, unpolluted, clear, the Dharma-vajra’ from 【*gauna-】 or 【*guna- 】‘pollution’, to 【gū, -ūha-】 ‘ excreta’, Av.【 gūθa-】, IE Pok. 4S3-5 【gụōu-: gụū- 】in a tetradic phrase; O.Ind. 【gūna- 】‘defecated’, cognates s.v. 【gū】.
‘markless’ (=BS【 animitta-】), Z 6-8; Manj. 167 【agūnai】.
‘ markless ’, v 131, ib2 【ṣä aggūnaigya tcalca 】‘ the boundary without mark’.
‘inexact’, N 148.31 =v 101, 102b2【<a>gumāta】.
‘not quarrelling’, v Ⅲ, 33VI, BS【 avivāda-】, to【gūrāsa-】.
‘invincible’, K 26.140 【aguhasta tta tta khu nārāya jasta】 ‘invincible like the deva-god Nārāyaṇa’, K35.86 【agvihasti】, K39.153 【agūhasta】, K18.214 【agvehasta】, =BS 【durdharṣa-】, to 【guhei】.
‘not injuring’, K 7, 14815, = BS 【aparihāṇi-】, Tib.【 mi ñams-pa】, to 【gauda-】.
‘indigestion’, Sid. 8r4, BS 【āma-】; Z 13.104 inst. sing, 【agvahäna】, from【 *vipaχθa-】 or 【*vipaχa-】 to【 pak-, gvach-, paha-, pajs-】.

‘limb’, Sid.2v4; Sid. 128v4 【aga-】, from 【ang-】‘ to bend’, in Av. 【anura-】 of 【zairimyanura-】 ‘with covered limbs’ epithet of the tortoise; to 【haṃguṣṭa-】, Oss. D. 【iuong, jong,】 I. 【uāng, uong, ong, 】plur. 【uängtä】 ‘limb’ (from【 *vivanga-】 or secondary 【iu-, j-, u-】). Zor.P.【 zarimangur 】has 【-ng-】 for Av. 【-n-】. The BS loan-word is in【 aṃga-prattyaṃga 】v 327a3. See 【agalaka】, s.v. 【aśa’ulaka】.

‘asa fetida’, Ⅲ 89.165; Sid. 1ov1, BS【 hingu-】, Sid. 12v4 【aṃgūṣḍa-】, Sid. 122r3【 agūṣḍạ-】, from 【*angu-jatu- 】(BSOAS2o,1957,50-2), TokharaB 【aṅkwaṣ】, Uigur 【'nk’pwš】, Chinese 【a-uei <â-ngjwei】; 【iang-kuei ‹ iang-g’jwi】 (KⅠ.Ⅰ; 1307.1; and K 210.1; 457.1), see BSOAS Ⅱ.786, and E. Pulleyblank, AM, n.s., 9,1962, 99 for the final 【-s】. West Iranian Armen, lw. 【angoužat, angžat, angoužataber】‘bearing 【silphium】, N.Pers. 【angužad, angudān, anguyān】. From 【*angu-ǰatu-】 with【ǰatu-】 ‘gum, resin’, 【Pašto žāwla】, O.Ind. 【jatu-, jatu-vāra-】 (JRAS 1955,17-18), N.Pers. 【žad】 ‘gum’. IE Pok. 480 【gųet-】. For the variation of Iranian 【angu-】 and O.Ind.【 hingu-】, note also the O.Ind. 【andola- 】and【 hindola-】 ' swing’. The plant belongs to the dry Iranian region.

‘she sewed’, K46.49 【ba khauysa byāṃdā u acā u ttu vajsya avījsyadai purakä ñūṣṭyā】 ‘ she found a small piece of cloth and she sewed and wrapped it round her afflicted blind son’. To 【ācana】 ‘ thread, BS 【sūtra-】’. Base 【čai-: či-】, with 【acā】 from 【*ačitātä and ācana】 from 【*ā-čyana-】. With 【č-> ž-】, M.Pers.T. 【’bzyngr】, M.Parth.T. 【’bjyn'gr 】‘ tailor’, N.Pers.【 āžīdan, āžadan, āžandan】 ‘to sew’; with 【kai-:ki-】 in Sogd. 【kyn'k 】‘sword’, O.Pers.【άκινάκης】, O.Ind. 【kīnāśa- 】‘plough_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x005f_x001f_man’ (TPS 1955, 67-69), adding BS cīmara- ‘metal, iron or copper’, to IE Pok. 917 (s)k(h)ai- ‘to cut, pierce’. For ‘ thread’ derived from ‘to sew’, note O.Ind. 【sīvyati, syūta, sūtra-】. For 【acā】, see also 【pacā 】'she covered’ from 【*pa(ti)- čatātä】, pres, 【pacan-】. See also 【mejanya-】 ‘embroidery (?)’. N.Pers. 【žanah】 ‘sting (of insect), point (of needle)’,

‘undestroyed, not perished’, K107.285; K108.303 【ajya】, Manj. 2 obliq. 【aje】, plural K 69, 2v1 【ajau】, K 66.138 【ajāṃ】; in the phrase 【ahamya- ajya-】 ‘ not produced, not perished’ the participle to the nominal phrase K 53.9.2-3 【hamāme jiṃgya jsa】, = BS 【utpāda-nirodha-】. The 【-jya, -ja】 is from【 jäta-, jita-】, participle to 【jin-】 ‘to perish’.
‘imperishable, inexhaustible’, v 171, 303b4; Bcd 44v2【 ajānaa-】, BS 【akṣaya-】; Bcd 50r2 fem. 【ajāṃja pājęñä】, BS 【akṣaya-kośah】, to 【jai-: ji-.】 pres.【 jin-】.

‘to pursue’, Ⅰ plur. Ⅱ 45.67; 46.89 【ajsāṃ】 ( VI 376; BSOAS 15, 1953, 537-8) to O.Pers. 【haǰ-】, O.Ind. sájati, saktá- ‘cling to’, with 【zga-】 in Av. 【spā vohunazgō 】‘the dog pursuing blood’, with lost 【h-】 (IE Pok. SS7-S seg-). See 【āysagamu】, and 【pahej-】.
‘not struck’, III75.235 【hamye vara ṣṭana ajsa】 ‘he was there unharmed' JS 36VI【 peṃ ajse】 ‘unbroken force’, to 【jsata-】 ‘struck’, base 【gan-: jata-】.
‘undeceivable’, K4,141r4, Tib. 【slu-bar mi mdzad-pa】; SuvO. 54V1, BS 【avisaṃvādanā】, to 【jsīr-】 : 【jsīḍa-】 ‘ to cheat ’.

‘desirable’, V115, 6417 【bryau ajseryau jsa】, BS 【iṣṭa-】; Z 24.438 【ttädrä näśtä ajserä panye uysnorä kho brī jīvätäd】 ‘there is not a desired thing to any being like dear life’, to a base 【gar-】 ‘to value’ or ‘ abuse’. The 【-js-】 derives from either 【-js-】 or 【-tc-】 intervocalic. See 【ggīraa-】 and 【pajarūṇa-】.

‘other ’, K 4, 141r5 【ka aysu aña hvāñiñi】 ‘ if I may speak other things’, Tib. 【gžan-du smra-bagyur-na】, III 25, 27a3 【ni aña】 ‘not the reverse’, BS 【ananyathā-vādī 】‘speaking otherwise’; repeated K 51.6.3【 añä añä】, K 49.3.8【 añi añi thāna】‘ various other places’, to 【anya-】, Av. 【ainya-】, O.Pers. 【aniya-】, Sogd. 【’ny, Yaγn. ane, ani】, M.Parth., M.Pers.T. 【’ny】, Iškāšmī 【an】, Waxī, Sarīkolī 【yan】, Oss. 【innä, annā】, IE Pok. 37 【an-, anio-】. Derivatives are SuvO. 68r7~68VI 【hastamo añänāmo】, BS 【parame viśiṣte】, Z 4.54 【añärāmä】 ‘other’; 【añadrāmā】, dyadic VS3, I3V4 【añädrrāmyau haṃdaryau】, Manj. 195 【husadā aysmva brrā añadrrāmā haudvyau naiśta】 (see s.v. hus-); K 54, 15r4 【rrų̄ ttūśā ni va añadrāmā näśtä】, K 54, 15r4 【añadrrāmā】, K55, 16r1【 añadrāmā naiśtā】, III104.27-8 【tta añarrva brraṣti 】‘so he asked other things (?)’.

‘ill-luck’, III 15.35 【hāysai añai hime】 ‘for him ill-luck becomes remote’; III 15.43 【hāysai śaṃda añai hime】 ‘for him ill-luck arises in a remote place’ (so improving on BSOS 8, 1937, 926-7). Hence 【*anaya-ka-】 to 【*anyaa~, añaa- 】to base 【nai-】 ‘be lively, bright, fortunate’, in O.Pers. 【naiba-】 ‘excellent’, Zor.P. 【nēv, nēvak, nēvakōk】 ‘good, fortunate ’, Oss. D. 【nivä】, I. 【nyv】 ‘ good fortune’, M.Parth.T. 【nys’g 】(【*nai-s-】) ‘bright’ to IE Pok. 760 【nei-:ni-】, Lat. 【niteō】, ‘shine’, Celtic O.Ir. 【noīb 】‘holy’. To this source can be traced also BS, Pali 【anaya-】 ‘misfortune’. Note loss of interior【 -a-】, as in 【gyasta-】 < 【*yazata-】.

‘not deficient; equipped with’, Manj. III 【usp(u)rra edrra jsa añasta】 ‘complete, possessing the faculties’ (BS 【indriya-】); =BS 【avikalendriya-】, K 30.207 【aidrrau jsa añaṣṭa】, variant K 38.141-2 【adrryāṃ jsi ukhsastä】 (read: 【uskhastä】), to 【nyaśś-】 ‘be weak, poor, deficient’.
‘untaught (?)’, II 13ob2, s.v. 【cista-】; and 【nyūta-】.

‘other’, III 73.178; 71.132; 74.194 【aḍä】, shortened from 【aḍara- 】(as 【pharu, pka】); loc. sing, IV 22.3.13 【aḍaña māśta】 ‘another month’, III 72.155【 tta ttai dyāṃdä aḍa vā daitte】 ‘so they saw him, the other (=the enemy) is seen’,

‘other’, III 76.55-6 【aḍarä ye cvāṃ pyaṃtsa ā】 ‘there was another who came before them’; III 69.103 a【ḍarä vā gīhyarä jse 】‘do you help to kill the other one’; Manj. 234 tin (pade)daima tta vā aḍara, variant Z 5.77 【ttū padandaimä u ttāru 】‘this I have created and the other (variant: that one) ’. From 【*ar-tara-】 to IE Pok. 25 【al-tera】 Lat. 【alter】.

‘vehicle’, Z 24.120 【brīk(o?) aḍari baḍe kuberä puṣpakī nāma】 ‘Kubera rides his favourite vehicle, its name is Puspaka’. Either base art- variant with 【vart-】 ‘to roll’, whence Sogd. 【wrtn *vartana-】 and related words, or * 【urtara-】 from 【vart-】, as in【udara-】 ‘crystal’ to 【varta-】‘stone’, and 【a- 】replacing 【u-】.

‘other’, III70.106 【aḍārä jsanām】 ‘the other we will kill’; loc. sing. K 45.24 【aḍāña ysīthai 】‘in another birth’, Manj. 237 【aḍauña】, variant Z 5.80【 ttārña】; inst. sing, III 71.129 【aḍārįna ttāja khu ā】 ‘when he came to another river’, in III 71.134 【aḍariṃ ttāja khu ā】; plural IV 20.16 【khu aḍārye vyauli yuḍāṃda】 ‘ so that you caused other alarms’; Sid. 132r5 【aḍārye,】 Tib. 【gźan】 ‘other’; V 268, 47a7 【aḍārye kvṃāyse vīra 】‘on the other side’. With initial【 i-】 in place of 【a-】 : K 146, 3v4 【jabvī-dvipa rrivye pa iḍarai hidva-kṣīrä Samattai nāma kṣīrä ṣṭe 】‘in Jambu-dvīpa in the south another Indian land there is by name the Samattai land’; II 89.45【u iḍāriṃ jsām hā ciṃgä rruṃdä hīvī haḍä】 ‘ and another messenger of the Chinese king ’; II III.36 【iḍāryāṃ iñakä】. From 【*ar-tāra-】 ‘other’ to 【aḍara-】, with 【-tāra-】 as Av. 【katāra-】, 【kataras čit̠】, Greek . 【πότεροι】 .

‘endless’,III 60.35 【ahakhīysa aṇaṃscya】 ‘numberless (and) endless’; 【aṇiṃscya 】JS 39r3; 【aṇeṃscya】 Bcd 57VI, BS 【ananta-】; compound, K 155.51 【aṇeṃscya-rāsṃä 】Bcd 44v2 【aṇeṃstyä】; JS 39r4 【aṇeṃscyānä】. See 【näṣaṃskya】, and 【analsca-】.
‘unoppressed’, K 52.7.2 【aṇahīśe harbaiśä bādä... byehīnä rāśṃä】‘unsuppressed always may I get dominion’. To v 113, 35v1 【anṛhīya-,】 BS 【anavamardita-】. See 【nihalj-】.
‘waterless’, II 85.27 【aṇūtcä mau】 ‘pure wine’. See 【ūtca】 ‘water’.
‘without desire’, Manj. 168 【aṇaṃusa na re parśta 】(= BS 【apraṇihita-】) ‘he no more passes without desire’; K 107.305 【anaṃusa】, K 55, 18r4 【anṃāṃsa-】, v 86, 5v2 【anaulsa-】.

‘excessively’, v 15, ib2 【ata śśāraṇä】 ‘great service’, ib3 【ata arrīmajse】 ‘very unclean’; v22, 1r6 【atä atär añi ośä】 ‘very unfriendly, bad’, v 131, 52v4 【atä dāru bulysu】 ‘very long’, v 183, 43v5 【atä duṣkarä】 ‘very wonderful’; v 164, 113r4 【atäphara-hvarātä mästa rre】 ‘the great king gluttonous’; to Av. ati, O.Ind. ati, IE Pok. 344, Greek Ετι. See also the preverb 【ti-, tti, ttu-, t-, tta-】.
‘unsurpassable’, JS 6v3 【attajsāḍa eṣṭāme vī】 ‘in supreme firmness’, to JS 13v4 t【tajsāḍai】 ‘you surpassed’, from 【*(a)ti-čārta-】, see 【pajsāḍa-, jairma-】.

‘intact’, K 68.190 【styūdi kiḍi attarrve baysgä】, K 71, 10v3-4 【styūda kīda attarve baysgä】 ‘hard, firm exceedingly, compact’, dyadic with 【styūda-】 ; possibly ‘unbroken’from base 【*ati-ruxta-】 as 【narrva-】 from 【*niruxta-】 ‘broken’,

‘unpolluted’, K 60, 34v4 【cu harbīśvā bāḍvā āttāyā ṣṭa】 ‘which in all times is unpolluted’, glossing BS 【suci-】and Khotan Saka vasvattd ‘purity’. From 【*a-tāyāna-】 to 【tā-】 ‘to melt, decay’ in Av. 【tāta-】, Oss. D. 【tajun, tad】, I. 【tajyn, tad】 ‘to melt, dissolve, corrupt’, D. 【tajnäγ】 ‘melting’, IE Pok. 1053 【tā-】: 【tə-】 ‘melt’ in O.Slav. 【taj, tajet】, O.Russ, 【tajati】,  O.Engl. 【pāwan】 ‘thaw’, Greek 【Τάκω】.
‘inconceivable’, SuvO. 36r6, BS 【acintya-】, see 【akāṣṭa-】, 【avāṣṭa-】, 【āṣṭa-】.

‘untrue, wrong’, K 56, 21r4 【u tte biśą dharma prracaḍa ṣṭāri attāhīrā svabhāvana ttūśā】; Manj. 145 【attāhīre hvāñ(ā)me jsa】 ‘with improper speaking’; Manj. 148 【harbaśa dharma attāherā deda vajsāre】 ‘ they see so many all 【dharma】-elements as bad’, without negative Manj. 371. 【ttāhīrai rraṣṭa payseda】 ‘he knows it to be right, correct’, see 【ttāhiraa-】 ‘right’, BS 【samyak】.
‘not returning’, BS avaivartika-, anāgāmin-. v 250.778; Ⅲ 113,  4r3 avīsadai; K 101.39 iīsedai. From īs- ‘to return’, with a- and hiatic -t-.
‘not empty’, = BS aśūnya-, Manj. 328.
‘significant, not empty’, Ⅱ53.2 attuśīma-nāmī ‘with significant name’; K 152.3 attuśīmä-nāmai. See tuśśaa- ‘empty’.
‘unsurpassable’, JS 6r3 panate ttye-v-ī mu’śd’ä pajsa attrīma ‘there arose for you strong unsurpassable mercy to him’, from *a-tramya-, to base tar- ‘to cross’, with increment -am-.
‘unsaved’, SuvP. 62v3, BS nistrāṇa-, see ttuvāy-, trvāy-.
‘exceedingly’, Bcd 45v2, see utvaḍa, Bcd 57v1 utvaḍirū ve.
‘unquiet’, JS 33r1 anaṣā’mde atsāṣṭa, dyadic.
‘not to be traversed’, K61, 39v2-3 tvā atsūmavīja tsūmą.
‘not taming, repressing’, v 117, 66v1 uysnaurāṇu adaṃgya, BS anigraha-, to dam- ‘ to tame’ in dīm-:danda-.

‘wrongful, unjust’, v 114, 63v4 adāta huṣṣa tsīndä ‘the irreligious prosper’, BS adharmo vardhate, to data-. K 15.117 adā kaiṇa, K 23.67 adā käṇa, K 31.24 adā kaiṇi ‘because of wrongs’; adātya- v 114, 63v3 ośānu adātyānu bvānānu, BS duṣkṛtānām; K15.114 adāyai, BS adharmeṇa.
‘unripened’, Sid. 103v2; 141r3, Tib. ma smin-pa, to dajs-, daja.

‘undimmed’, K 152.10 vasva adū agū pā’  ‘pure, undimmed, unpolluted, clear’, epithet of the jñāna- paramitā, from dau-: du ‘to obscure’, in Khotan Saka dumä ‘smoke’, Zor.P. dūt, N.Pers. dūd ‘smoke’, Khotan Saka duya ‘dusty (?)’; IE Pok. 261-7 dheu-.

‘invisible’, v110, 32v1 adyāneina ttarandarna ‘with invisible body’, BS adṛśyair ātmabhāvaiḥ; v 52.83b1 dyānai päṣkalä, u adyānei päskalä paśemate kä<dana> ‘conspicious attribute; and for abandoning the ugly attribute’.
‘not sight’, Ⅲ 28, 39a1-2 dyāma adyāma, BS dṛṣṭi; adṛṣṭi-.
‘to breathe’, see uysana-, uysaṃdī, uysānā.
‘unnumbered, countless’, SuvO. 68v4 anaṃkhästa nayuta satä ysāre kūla, BS acintiyā niyuta-sahasra-koṭiyo; I 252, 1a4 gen. plur. <a>naṃkhiṣṭinu raṃnānu, BS aneka-ratna-, see haṃkhīysa-.
‘endless’, Manj. 16 anacī raśa’, see aṇe’scya.

‘limitless (?)’, Manj. 42 aysmva sa vasūjāña anada tc(e)rai ‘the mind is just to be purified, it is to be made unlimited (?)’. Possibly to Oss. D. ändä, I. ädtä ‘outside’; hardly BS ananta-. See īyānda-.
‘to tolerate’, v 135, 1a4 anaṃdīśśānaina a<ysmūna> ‘with tolerant (indifferent) mind’. See araṃdīśś-.
‘not forgetting’, K 143, 1r3, see hāmuri, ahāmurgya-.
‘infrangible’, Manj. 348-9 harbaiśā dharmā prrara apanava anarrūjya ‘the nature of all dharma-elements is non-originated, unbreakable’.

‘not poured upon’, Ⅲ 92.237 u na-ānahā anarva māśa’kä tcerą̄ ‘(the poultice) must be made of the plant māśa’kä (BS mācikā) unmoistened’, from ā-nah- ‘pour upon, moisten’, dyadic with anarva ‘not poured upon’; hence from base rau- ‘flow’, anarva < *a-niruta-, distinct from anarrva- <  *a-niruxta- ‘unbroken’.
‘of endless splendour’, v 123, c2v5, to näṣa’skya ‘end’, and BS tejas-.
‘unquiet’, JS 33r1, see niṣam-, niṣaunda-.
‘without a share’, v 29, 47v4 ta anasu ne kaśte ‘so he does not come to be shareless’.
‘unseizable’, K63, 78r1; K 52.10.10 anihvarrdye, =BS agrāhya-. See nuhvarr-.
‘without’ Manj. 374 anā rū rūvyā daitta ‘he sees the formed things (BS rūpiya-, -ka-) to be without form’ (BS rūpa-), see s.v. hajse ‘ form ’. Here anā for older anau, ano.
‘not bound (?)’, Ⅲ 104.36 paśa’ rai aṃ.nā raṣṭa ‘sunshine, unchecked, direct’. From *a-nāxta- to nāj- ‘to join’, in nāju, haṃnāj-; but possibly ąhanā < *ahaṃnāxta-.
‘free from disease’, N 76.15 anāchā himäta jya-āchā ‘they became free of disease, healthy’, BS nānārogebhyah parimocitāni, arogāṇi babhūvuḥ. See āchai ‘illness’.
‘undisturbed’, Ⅲ 131a3 anāphäḍa dvāredärśyau hudahī<nyau> ‘undisturbed, with 32 mahāpuruṣa (marks)’, to phar- see āphir-, āphiḍa-.
‘inactive’, SuvO. 24r4 BS niśceṣṭa-, from ā-rūh- ‘to move’.

‘without fault, innocent’, v 339, 79r1 tta hvate se anārrä gyasta balysa naḍe ysaṃthu kuṣṭa nāte ‘so he spoke, saying, O deva Buddha where did the innocent man take birth?’, BS āha, anaparādhikasya bhagavan puruṣasya kutropapattih; v 64.42 anārī from anārrä yi; see ārra- ‘fault’.
‘isolated’, Z 24.445 ṣī jaḍī anāvu ‘this is only ignorance’, -āvu beside au, o as Z 13.113 āvuṣṭe ‘lips’ beside Ⅲ 130a1 austä. See anau.

‘inaccessible (?)’, Z 12.71 parigraha ttrāma cu ṣṣāvānu anāśśa ‘such possessions which are inaccessible to śrāvaka-listeners’; Z 10.9 ggaṃbhīra vasuta anāśśa. . . bvāmata ‘profound, pure, inaccessible bodhi-knowledge’. See nas- in hanas-.
‘unworthy’, JS 28v4-29r1 anāṣi’ṇe nāvai phare ysaṃthe veśūna ‘you accepted many unworthy evil births ’; to āṣa’ṇa- ‘worthy’.
-?-, v 128, 457 anās(t)anä bo<dhisatvä>.

‘disjointed’, Z 20.39 anāskotta darra ‘disjointed, torn up’, with -skautta- in Bcd 48r3 haskauttä, BS abhiyukta- ‘joined’. Base skaup- or skaub- in skumb- of Šuγnī wiškamb-:wiškūvd ‘to sort (wool)’, O.Slav. skubati ‘pluck, ravel out’, IE Pok. 955 skeubh-.

‘without beginning’, Z 5.85 ttäna anāstanä hvatä saṃtsāri, =Manj. 243 anāsta satsāra hva ‘therefore samsāra is said to be beginningless’; Z 9.26 anāstan ahämäta, =Manj. 404 anāstaina ahaimye ‘beginningless non-produced’, to āstana-.

‘refugeless’, v 381, 3b3, BS nirāśa- ‘hopeless’, v 63.31 anāspitāṃ sattāṃ; v 64.2 anāspe; JS 22v1 anāspeta anāha (BS anātha-); JS 28v2 anāspete śatcaṃpha; Ⅲ Ⅱ, 21r3 anāspāyeri ‘more refugeless’. See āspātā- ‘refuge’.

‘hostility’, K 35.82 animūnäīnīyi ‘was planning enmity’, = K 18.203 avamauna īde ‘he works contempt’ (BS avamāna-), = K 26.133 ñahara āstada ‘he began trouble’. See nimāna- ‘regret’. Possibly animūna- for *avamāna-.
‘not contemptible, not humble’, v 111, 33v1 aniyaśśu aṣṭakulcu, BS abhaṇḍana- ‘not abusing’. See niyaśśa-, ñaśa-.

‘lack of virility, non-virility’, v 52, 83a4 paṃjsa päta’ñä anīratete u dīḍetä hamurgyatetä, bätandetä ‘the five powers, non-virility, and low character, forgetfulness, confusion of mind, <folly?>’, the BS panca-bala- of śraddhā, vīrya-, smṛti-, samādhi-, prajñā, in reverse, if it is accepted that dīḍetä can correspond to ṣraddhā and bätandetä to samādhi-. This gives the analysis *a-naryatāti to nara- ‘man’ with -īra- < -arya-. The context excludes an-arya- ‘ignoble’.

‘without grasping’, v 124, 4b4; K 53.10.10 akāṣṭye anihvarrdye bāvani gīhna, K 63.78r1 akāṣṭye anahvardye bāvaña gīhna ‘by aid of bhāvanā- meditation inconceivable, ungraspable’, Manj. 354 anūhvarada, =BS agrāhya-. See nuhvarr- ‘to grasp’.
‘not adult’, Z 22.123 paṃjsa-satä-saluvo anūḍo ‘not adult at age 500 years ’; Z 24.125 rrundi dūta anūḍa ‘king’s daughter not adult’. See ūḍa- ‘grown, old’, base barz-:bržda- ‘to grow in size’.
‘uncovered’, Ⅲ 12, 21v5 ṣa cu anūḍa vrrīśe ‘he who wears (the thread) being unclothed’. See ūḍa- ‘covered ’ from base var- ‘to cover ’.
Manj. 354 ‘not grasped (polluted)’ like the lotus in mud.
Manj. 278; 317, to nuhvar- ‘to grasp’.
‘not defeated’, v 113, 35v1 īṇete hīñe jsa anṛhīyä ‘unbeaten by alien army’, BS anavamardita-. See also aṇahīśe. Base ni-θrang- ‘to press down’.
‘unenduring’, Manj. 270 aneṣṭava mvaśta’ bure pīttä ‘being unstable, within a short time fails’, = Ⅲ 29, 42b2 mu’śa’ buri pīttä.
‘unsubstantial’, SuvO. 24r4 ttarandarä anārūhä u ayicä u aneṣṭavanä, BS kāyaś ca niśceṣṭa nirvyāparaś ca asārakaḥ ‘the body motionless and inactive (BS akṛtya-) and unsubstantial’. See eṣṭ-.

‘without’, Sid. 15v1 anau hvadä khaṣṭą, BS annapānād ṛte ‘without food and drink’, Ⅲ 21, 9b2 anau rūväna, BS arūpiṇaḥ ‘formless’; ano JS 37v4. From ana-, see also anāvu. To Greek ἄνευ, Goth. inu, O.Saxon āno beside M.Parth.T. ’n’-, Oss. DI. änä-, and Sogd. nw-, IE Pok. 318 eneu. See also anā.
‘without desire’, v 86, 5v2, K 108.305 anausa, Manj. 168 aṇau’sa-, see olsa-.
‘not eternal’, Ⅲ 24, 21a1 anauṣkājsī, Z 22.271 anauṣkāmjsye, v 52, 83b2 <a>noṣkājsya hära oṣkājsya nai härānu; v 52, 83b2 anauṣkājsyatetä. See oṣku.
see anada, īyāndu, biśśīnda.
‘in the interval’, SuvO. 68r2, BS tad-antareṇa. See handara-.
‘not despondent’, Sid. 7v1, BS aviṣādī, Tib. sro śi-ba. See nuvaṃth-.
‘difficult’, Sid. 103v2 anvaśta, Tib. dkah-ba ‘difficult’; JS 2r1 vṛttä anvaśta ‘the metre difficult’ (BS vṛtti-). See nvaśta- ‘easy’.

‘opposed, hostile’, SuvP. 72r4 anvaśtā ṣai śe satvä, BS pratikula-darśī; Ⅱ 109.5 anvaśtā barāṃ, Ⅱ 84.20 anvaśtā sahyām:dūm ‘we suffered opposition’; Sid. 9v4 anvaśtävai ni hime, BS viruddham na bhavet; v 246, 12a2 anvaśte vaśu’de bīśī janīdä (BS omits). From a- and (a)nu- ā-stay- ‘to conform’.
‘immodesty’, Manj. 67 aksārmauña apakṣarāttai, = BS hrīr apatrapā. See pakṣäre and kṣārma, kṣär-.
‘not creating’, v 131, 1b2. See padīm-: padanda-.
‘not arising’, Ⅲ 32.7. See panam-:panata-.
‘not arisen’, K 55, 17v4, and Manj. 349. See panam-.
‘dissatisfaction’, SuvP. 63v3, BS atṛpti-. See phan-.
‘unknown’, Sid. Ⅰ bis r1, see paysān- ‘to recognise’.
‘indigestion’, BS āma-, v 322.126, =Sid. 12v3 ahahä. See also agvaha-, BS āma-.

‘attacks it’, v 66.9 apahāyśīye-t-ī ṣṭakūlai yanāti ṣi’ hvi mūlą, bāśtä mīḍi ‘he who may attack it and abuse it, that man dies presided over by the Rat’. Parallel phrase v 330, 13v4 sūtru aprramā<nu ya>nde, BS G 37, Ⅱb3 sad-dharma-pratikṣepād, v 388, 19r1 ttu dātu apramānu yanāre, BS G 37, 13b6 sad-dharma-prati-kṣepakaiḥ satvaiḥ; also SuvP. 64v1 cu dā prakṣauttai īme, BS sad-dharmaḥ prakṣiptaḥ syād. . .me; K 61, 41r4 ci ttu sūttrą prrakṣīvīdi. Hence apahāysīye denominative from *pahāysa- ‘grasping, approving’ to base haz- ‘seize’, Av. haz-, O.Ind. sahate, IE Pok. 888-9 seĝh-, Greek ἔχω, ἔσχον.
‘without fat’, Sid. 135r4, Tib. śa-snum bag čhuŋ-ba. See päyä ‘fat’.
‘unchecked’, see ipihī, avi’ hī, avīhī.

‘uninterrupted’, Ⅲ 48.6 apūṣṭye bhāvana gīhna, K 112.372 apvaṣṭya bāvaña gīhna ‘by help of uninter-rupted bhāvanā-meditation ’; 11 72.5 śā salī śiri apvaṣṭi khu vyachīṃdi harbaiśi pīle ‘ (exert yourselves) for one year well, uninterruptedly, so that all troubles vanish’. Possibly =BS anācchedya-; Ⅲ 53.111 BS anāchida. See -pūṣṭa-, from *pa(ti)brašta- ‘break off’. Parallel to K 54, 14r2 aharṣṭä bhāvana.
‘uninjured’, Ⅱ 103.59 kalpāṃdāṃtta dai jsa apai’cāmttä ṣṭāna ‘being uninjured by the fire of the kalpa- age’s end’, to pa’tcautta-, petcautta- ‘injured, checked’, Tib. ñams-śiŋ.
‘a plant name’, Sid. 13v4, BS sugandhaka-, Tib. sugandhika. If the name is translated, pauca- from pau-:pū- ‘to rot’ would yield a name ‘not putrid’, hence ‘sweet’. See haṃbūta-, puva, phuva-.

‘speechless’, Manj.329 apyāya vī śā pava (BS pada- ‘verse’) pyūṣḍe harbaśu pyūṣṭa pachīysde ‘the dumb hears one verse, he can hear all’; Manj. 381 vaina hvāñāka apyāyau vī kūṣṭa drrā mase ṣkaujai nai īda ‘without speaker, in non-speaking, where to the extent of a hair there are not saṃshāra-acts’. See pätāy- ‘to speak’.

‘not heard’, Ⅰ 254v4 pyūṣṭu u apyūstu ‘heard and not heard’, BS śrutvā; beside K Ⅰ, 135v2 ttu pyūṣṭu pyūṣḍe ne avyūṣṭu pyūṣḍe ‘he hears that heard (thing) he does not hear the unheard’; Tib. thos-pa ñid thos-pa yin-gyi, ma thos-pa-las thos-pa ma yin-pa. See pyūv’-: pyūṣṭa-.
Ⅱ 72.5, see apūṣṭye.
‘without fear, danger’, K 28.180 parśta apvaine ‘escapes without fear’ parallel to K 29.184 parśta avesta ‘escapes unafraid’. See pu’vaṇa- ‘fear’.
‘without fear, safe’, Ⅱ 123.4091.6 apvenye bāḍä  ‘in a safe time’.

‘pejorative adjective’, Ⅲ 69.93-4 kṣārma bīdāṃdä pharākä, śūrī-vaṃ aphārä hamye ‘they felt much shame, their valour became a disgrace’. Once aphāra- is variant to haphāra-; K 70, 5v1 tta drūjana aphāra hūñīdä, =K 67.158 tti drūjina haphārä hvāñīṃdi ‘so with falsehood they speak confusion’. Base phar- ‘to speak’, pharā- ‘speech’, pher- ‘to speak’ from phāraya-, or base phar- ‘to disturb’, or with later -r- for -rr- from phārra- ‘fortune, high position’, or with a- from ā- for *āphāra- ‘disturbance’, uncertain.
‘not bound’, Manj. 304 abasta harbaśa satva ‘freed all beings’, to bañ-:basta-.
‘untimely’, v 170, 2r4; v 125, 6b3 kvī abāḍä nīroskasāte ‘when untimely water floods him’ in a list of untimely deaths, BS akāla-maraṇāni.
‘not confused’, SuvO. 5r2, BS samāhita-, later abyaṃda-.
‘without doubt’, v 158, 193r4 thu abätamai hämu ‘be without doubt’, later abyamai, Ⅰ 185, 104r2 abyamiṃ (-iṃ = -ai), BS nātra saṃśayaḥ.
‘unwakened’, K 34.64 abīysādi khu jiśtä ‘unawakened like a devī-goddess’, variant K 25.114 avayseda khva jaśta, to biysānda- ‘awakened, aware ’, BS saṃbuddha-. See biysān- ‘to awake’.
‘without tongue’, v 146, 71v4 ā vā abiśātä u kārrä ‘either dumb or deaf’, to biśā- ‘tongue’.
‘not aware’, SuvP. 63r3, BS ajānanta-; abstr. abus<t>attäte v 139, 1a5; Manj. 342 abusta-; SuvO. 24v7 abustatete jsa, BS avidyayā.
‘misfortune’, L 89.3 vina abe’mañānu, see be’maña-, quoted s.v. āphārana-.
‘weak’, Ⅱ 109.2789.5-6 ama ttaña haśa’ abaumaya hamarya ‘you in that place may be weak’, to būmaya, būmatä ‘strong’.
K 56, 21v3 abausti prracaina, Manj. 342; 344, to abusta-.
‘not confused’, Manj. 147, see abätanda-.
‘not open’, K 21.9; abyāva K 29.183, variant K 37.123 abyāṣṭi, see bā’tai ‘open’ and base s.v. biyāśś-.
‘not reached’, K 54, 15v3 abyāṃda ttuśāttā, = BS abhāva-śūnyatā, later form of abyauda- from byeh- ‘to get’.
‘at dawn’, Ⅱ 16, 4b5 khu ma abyūṣṭä vīra kaṃthä hīsīṃdä ‘when here at dawn they come to the city’, to byūṣṭa- ‘lightened, dawned’.
‘not attainment’, Manj. 165 ba’ysūña pade abyehāme jsa cerāña, to byeh-.
K 57, 26r4 cu abyehāṣṭejsa bīdi ba’ysūśtä ‘who by not attainment got bodhi-knowledge’; Manj. 371 cva abyehāscyī jsa baiśa ttāhīrai rraṣṭa payseda ‘who by not attainment knows all correctly, rightly’.

‘not reached, not found, non-existent’, Manj. 233 padīmāka abyauda ‘creator not found’, Manj. 296 nairāttama abyaudä ‘non-self not existent’, K 108.303-4 ysyāma u ysara maraṇa baiśa ahamya ajya abyauda ‘birth and old age, death all are not produced, not perishing, not existent’. See byeh-:byauda-.
‘not asked’, v 117, 66r6, BS apṛcchitvā.
‘not dear’, Manj. 384-5 bvāme jsa harbaśa daitta abrrīyī brrīyī rasta sa khu pūra āye uca ‘by bodhi- knowledge all appears not liked, (and) liked, just as the moon is seen in water’. See brya-.
‘not destroyed’, v 113, 35v1 abva<tä a>ysmū hämāñu, BS avikṣipta-cittena ‘with mind undistraught’, Z 5.114 abuvatu, Z 22.291 abvata-, with first written abutu. See buvan-, BS vilupyate, upahata-.

‘abundant’, Manj. 245 va(ṣa)ya āvīda abvātta (the mind) sees the abundant sense-objects’ (BS viṣaya-) variant to Manj. 348 vaiṣaya āvīda pharāka ‘sees many sense-objects’; and variant Manj. 246 vaṣaye āvada abvatta (read āv(ī)da abv(ā)tta). Possibly from a- intensive (see IE Pok. 281-2 e-, o-) with base bau- ‘to abound’, see s.v. buru. With participle -āta-, as in gaisātta- ‘returned’ (*gṛtsāta-). See also Oss. äbualγ ‘extraordinary’; with adjective äbualγ tyxdžyn ‘exceedingly violent’ from *a-bvāga-, and O.Ind. RV ábhva-, AV abhvà-, ‘monstrous’ beside víbhvan-, noted BSOAS 20, 1957, 48.
‘not experienced’, Manj. 75 śara dī kīra abvāṣṭa ‘unexperienced in good and bad works’. See bvāṣṭa-.
‘not knowing’, SuvP. 63r3, BS aprajānanta-; SuvP. 64v2 abvīya, BS ajānanta-. See buv-:busta-, with suffix -īya-, as ysīnīya-.
‘you’, 2 plural, K 154.42; K 61, 42r2. See umä, imi.
‘not thinking’, v 131, 1r1 dyadic before akā’mate jsa āste. See mañ-.

‘distress, distressful’, v 29, 47r3 o yi jsa ysīru pätāyätä o ye vā vätä amatau nätā’yätä ‘either speaks roughly to one or commands one harshly ’ with parallel ysīra- ‘rough’ and amatau; v 30, 73v1 amatauya kaśte hvaittä ‘he falls into distress, he is beaten’. Later amauva-, loc. plural amauvuā, Ⅲ 113, 4v3-4 cvai nāma hvāñi amauvuā byaugvā baṃdana-śālvā ni kaśti ‘he who cites the name does not fall into harsh bonds, into prisons’; v 250.783-4 cvai nāma hvāñe amauvuā byūṃgvā baṃdana-śālvā na kaśte; K 102.46-7 cvai nāma hvāñe ni imauvuā byūṃgvā u ni baṃdana-śālvā kaśte. From base am- ‘to treat violently’, Av. Yasna 71.17 xšayasča amayavā̊sča, Zor.P. gloss šēvan ut mōδak ‘ lament and woe’, to Av. ama- ‘force’, O.Ind. ama- ‘force’, amīvā- ‘illness’, amīti ‘to injure’, participle -ānta-. For the suffix -au, loc. sing, -auya, gen. plur. -vāṃ, inst. plur. -vyau, note sarau ‘lion’, plur. sarauva, gen.plur. sarautāṃ, loc. sing. rraysauya ‘empty’, hamau ‘bowl’, inst. plur. hamvyau, parau ‘command’, gen. plur. parauvāṃ jsa, loc. sing. parauya.

amayai ‘title (before proper names)’, K 100.292 amayai khara-painä; K 100.290 amayai maukṣaidra; K 100.294 amayai ejattūha’, K 100.297 amayai arsa[nd]lana; v 237, 31-39 amaye cīna kharasana, 34 amayai cīna ṣau kharasana. Possibly *amayaka- ‘forceful, in authority’ from base am- (see amatau). Possibly from maya-, māya ‘fortunate’.
‘your’, Ⅲ 69.104 amājai parau ‘your command’. See umājaa-.
‘not like’, K 5, 144r4 atä amāñanda, see māñanda-.
‘not like’, K 5,144r4 duṣkarūṇa amāñandūna salāva hvatāndä, Tib. ŋo-mćhar rmad-du byun-bahi čhos-kyi sgra hang hbyin-to, ‘they spoke astonishing wonderful words’.
‘unfermented’, Sid. 20v4 amāstą ñye ‘unfermented buttermilk’, BS manda-jātaṃ tu mastu (=maṇḍa-), Tib. źo ma langs-pa. See māsta-, māya-, meva.
‘pitilessness’, v 130, 49a3. See mulysdi.
‘merciless’, Ⅲ 38-50, see amu’śdye.
‘pitiless’, JS 28r1; Ⅲ 49.31 amvai’śda’. See mulysdi.
‘old woman’, K 38.136, variant K 29.198 māmā.Widely used, Germanic OHG amma, O.Norse amma, Span. mama, Greek μάμα Lat. mamma, O.Ind. ambā.
‘in troubles’, see amatau.
‘mango’, Sid. 14r1; Sid. 18v2 ambrrä, loan-word O.Ind. āmra-. Sogd. n’mry ‘sweet’ is from *an-āmraka-, see āhvaraa-.

‘without core’, Ⅲ 49.16 cu baiśä hīra amya butte ‘who understands all dharma-elements to be without sub­stance’, like BS asāraka- ‘without firm inner part’. From *a-madya- to myāna- ‘centre’ from *madyāna-, Zor.P. miyān, Sogd. Bud. mδ’ny, myδ’ny ‘in the middle’, Av. maiδya-, Oss. D. medäg, I. midäg. See myāna-.
‘invisibility (?)’, Ⅱ 115.23 haira jsā sāja na tta paṣṭa ayakṣā ‘study the dharma-elements, do not set out to the unseen’. See pyaṣṭa- ‘visible’.

or ay.va ‘epithet of demons’ (second akṣara lost), v 64.45-6 cu būri āśa’ ṣṭāna auda ay.sa kalabūttana ti biśa maṃ parauya ṣṭāri ‘whoever being in the sky (BS ākāśa-) down to the kalapūtana demons, those all are under my orders’. Reading and connexion unknown.
‘sterile’, Z 2.226; Manj. 256 aysaga. See ysan- ‘to bear young’.
‘sing’, see aysmūr-.
‘girl’, v 291, 14a1 (fragment). See a’ysānai.
‘unborn’, Z 6.7; Manj. 250 aysāye mera nai īda, from ysan-: ysāta- ‘be born’.
‘boy’, K 140.987, see alysānai.
‘a medicament, plant name’, Ⅲ 85.78; Ⅲ 85.84 aysā’yä.
‘lively (not despondent)’, Ⅱ 40.38 hīrāsaka iysīye basaka jsi ‘from the black frisky calf’ (SDTV 121), see ysīta-.

‘I’; with pronouns ayse, aysi, aysai, aysām, aysā; with ī ‘indeed’ aysai; Manj. 154 ayse; K 137.905 aysi; Ⅲ 75.221 aysai; Ⅲ 69.103 aysāṃ; Ⅲ 71.128 aysā (-ā ‘you’); K 47.53 aysai ‘I indeed’. With independent pronoun K 47.53 aysā ūhū ‘ I... you’; SuvO. 3v7 aysuṃ jsa. Av. azǝm, O.Pers. adam, Pašto ǝa, Waxī wuz, Ormuṛī az, Sogd. ’zw; Oss. äz. O.Ind. aham, IE Pok. 291 O.Slav. azŭ, Greek έγών.

‘of aysūra-colour’, Ⅱ 60.8-9 kabala śā u aysūra-gūna dajūna baimya kamaiśkä ‘one kambala-cloth (BS kambala-) and of aysūra colour, flame-coloured bright kamiśka-cloth’. Possibly az-:za- ‘blue’ with -a- bara-, see ysamye ‘vitriol’.
‘not pleasant’, Ⅲ 60.45 aysūṣkä mari vīvā nāṃda maṃ vi satva ‘unpleasant here the beings accepted vipāka- ripening in my case’; SuvP. 73v1, BS aniṣṭa-.

‘vulture’, JS 24v1 pura ra pe’me’ṣṭi aysgaṃ ‘the vulture seized the young ones’; K 21.4 aysgana-rūvyi ‘in vulture-form’, K 28.179 -e; K 37.117 vari aysgini-rūvya śā rakṣä’jsi mūñye ‘there dwells one demoness (BS rākṣasī) in vulture-shape’. See uysgana-.
‘uncovered’, Ⅲ 98-27, see uysgusta-.

‘a commodity’, possibly ‘goat’s corn’, v 174a1 u aysdāṃ 10śeṃ (=daśeṃ) hvaṃḍä gūñä 1 baṃ 1 ‘and corn (?) for ten men, one sack, one packet’; v 174, a2 u aysdāṃ kha 4 auśyaka aysdāṃ kha 2 ‘and corn (?) 4 kha-measures and Auśyaka corn (?) 2 hha-measures (similarly with other names); v 174b12 ṣi’ vā aysdāṃ puḍai ‘he presented corn (?)’. Tumšuq eźdanā kalasta ‘skin-­bag for corn (?)’ may belong here (see karasta-). Base aza- ‘goat’, Av. aza- with dānā- ‘grain’. The aza- is in the Nīrangastān 114v9, Zor.P. ’z, ’zy, Caucasian Adige ač’e, Qabard aže.

‘supporter (?)’, Ⅱ 80.12 ṣą mä aysdārä aśau’laka svaha’ka ‘this my supporter unharmed, in safety ’; ‘main­tenance’, Ⅱ 125.5-6 u īñakä bisā iysdāra tti jsām vā rrvī vī haiṣṭāṃdä ‘ and the maintenance of the company they then sent to the Court’, see AM, n.s., Ⅱ, 1964, 13. Base uz- with dār- ‘hold’, see iysdāḍa-, 11 111-17 iysdāḍe si ‘he reported that. . .’. See aysdaura-.
‘safe’, Ⅱ 82.58 ṣa ma sagaśīla tceną aysdeña svahä’ka, parallel to Ⅱ 80.12 ṣą mä aysdārä aśau’laka svaha’ka, quoted s.v. aysdāra-. From *uysdāranya- ‘supported, safe’.
‘to blow upon, cool’, Sid. 152v1 aysdemāñä* to be cooled’, Tib. bsgranŋs-la; Participle aysdauda Sid. 20r4. See dam- ‘to blow’, uysdam-.

‘young’, Sid. 6v5; 7r3 BS bāla-; aysdo Sid. 7r1. From *azatāva- from arz- ‘ to grow ’, Oss. D. iräzun, iräzt, I. räzyn, räzydtän, räzt ‘to grow’. IE Pok. 26-7 al- ‘to grow’ (see alīya-) with increment. See alysānaa- ‘youth’,
‘possession’, Ⅲ 80.20 majṣyī jsaiṇi aysdaurä ‘the woman’s fine property’. See aysdāra-.

‘tears away, steals’, Ⅲ 36-7 aysdyūva ragyau jsa gesta yäda īsakye ‘ tears from the banks, turning, it makes whirlpools’, = Ⅲ 34.12 aysdyäva ragā jsa gesta yada īsakye, = Ⅲ  40.15 aysadruvą raṃgyau jsä gąistą īsakyai yaṃdai, = Ⅲ 46.20 aysdyūävi ragāṃ jsa gestą yida dvanakye. See also K 56, 20r4 viṣaya āysdyūvi ‘steals the objects of sense’. Base dabya- > dyū-, with -vi from -äte, see cog­nates s.v. dyūka ‘robbers’.

‘squatting’, Sid. 102v5 aysdrraphai *ñāma (written brrāma) ‘sitting in squatting position’, BS utkuṭikāsanam, Tib. ćog-ćog-pur hdug-pa. Base draf-, dramf- from IE *dhrembh- ‘hold together’, cf. Yidγa dīzo ‘squatting’ han-daizā-.

‘consisting of an excursion place, park’, K 49.3.7-8 padmāysina kūlārä pātcä, śira gvahe añi añi thāna aysdravaṣṭa vasva ūryāna ‘lotus seats, pavilions next, excellent abodes, various places, park-like clean gardens’. From *uz-drava- ‘place of excursion’, with adjectival suffix -sta-, dyadic with BS udyāna- ‘idem’. To base drav-: dru- ‘to run’ in Av. drāvaya-, draoman-, aēšmō. drūta- ‘attacked by aēšma-fury’, glossed Zor.P. ēšm-drūt, with Zor.P. hnrwn, Pāzand handurun (Mēnōk ī xrat, ed. An-klesaria, 5.6), O.Ind. dravati, druta-; IE Pok. 204-6 dreu-.
‘he flew up’, Ⅲ 73.180 aysdrauttä mā’ hā pūṣa pastä ‘the fly flew up, at once it fell away’. See drrautta hamīya ‘is able to fly’, base drāh-.

‘channel (?)’, something made of stone, Ⅲ 80.31 baysga aysbanä sagīnā ṣperīdä ‘the many stone channels pour out’; Ⅲ 37.8 spyakīnai byauśau’ka īhe’ja aysbanvāi ‘the flower bud is stopped in the channels’; Ⅲ 34.13 spyakīnai pyauśa’ka ai’heja aysbanakvā; Ⅲ 46.22 <s>pya- kīnai pyauśaką iheja aysbanakvā. From *uz-band- ‘to hold back by a bank’, like N.Pers. band ‘weir’, Pašto wasta ‘pool’, see s.v. pastā-.
‘to roast’, Sid. 146r2 aysbrījsāñä, Tib. brŋos-pa; Sid. 147r4 iysbrījsāñä; Sid. 147v4 eysbrrījsāñą. From uz- with braig-, see cognates s.v. brījs-.

‘mind’, rendering BS manas- (Ⅲ 21, 8b3 aysmya yaṃ, BS manasi kuru), BS mata- (v 244, 4b4 aysmūna, BS matena), BS citta- (v 330, 20r3 aysmū panata, BS G 37, 17r5 cittam utpādayām āsuḥ), BS cetana- (Bcd 49r3 aysmuna, BS cetanato), BS vijñāna- (K 56, 20v3), and K 5, 144v1 aysmuī vaṣṭāmato, BS samādhi-. Inflected forms are nom. sing, aysmū, aysmu, later aysmva; gen. sing, aysmuvä, aysmuvi, nva aysmūi, aysmuī, aysmvī; inst. sing, aysmūna, aysmu jsa; loc. sing, aysmya; uncertain Ⅲ 130.23 aysmyani. With the pronoun yi K 58, 28r3, Z 24.196 aysmūtī. Adjectives are -yaa- v91, 611r2 aysmuyai, parallel to biśātīnai (with -t-, not -n-) ‘of the tongue’; -īnaa-, Manj.40 aysmvīnaa-, JS19r3 aysmvījvā; aysmūnaa-, adjective, ‘ of the mind’, Ⅲ 44.41-2 aysmūna pūna ‘ arrows of the mind’; ibid, aysmūnai bīsana ‘by the mental servant’; and -ja- Sid. 3Ⅱ aysmyaja, BS mānasa-. Dyadic are K 56, 20v1 aysmū vijñānä, and Ⅲ 71.143 aysmū uvī. Compounds are Sid. 7v1 garkha-aysmu ‘heavy-minded’; II 89.39 sāḍa-aysmva ṣṭāre ‘are cold-minded’, and v 123, 3r2 <du>ṣkareñäna ārāhäta-aysmuvā(fem. nom. sing.), BS vismaya-āvarjita-mānasā ‘with mind drawn by astonishment’. Two later spellings dissolve the conjuncts Ⅱ 130, b6 aysamū, and K 72.27 aysimūna. Analysis still not decided. Possibly uz-mu- from ays- (anticipating later ays- from uys-), with -mu- by -u- suffix from man-:ma- ‘to think’ (IE Pok. 726-8 men-). The basic ‘thinking’ contrasts with uysānā ‘self’ from an-:ā- ‘to breathe’. See Addendum.

‘to sound’, Ⅲ 36.5 sānä aysamvīrradā tsīda ha’da spūläkau ‘(the birds) range singing amorously among the buds’ (BS sphoṭaka-), with -mvīrr- from mvar-y-, parallel to gvīr- ‘sound, sing’ from gvar-y- Ⅲ 34.10 sāha’na gvīradā tsīda hada spūlakau, = Ⅲ 46.18 sā’ha’na gvīradą̄ tsīda hadaṃ spūälakām. See aysmūra-.

‘sound, noise’, Ⅲ 34.16 aysmūryau jūhānai sāñīda pavanaka ‘amorous with sounds they raise the pollens’, = Ⅲ 46.26 āṃysmūryau jūhānai sāñīda pavinaka, = Ⅲ 37.11 āṃysmūryau jūhaunai sāñä pavänaka. From uys- with base mūr-, mvīr- ‘to sound, sing’ see s.v. mura- ‘ speech’.

‘to overlook, tolerate, be indifferent’, v 99, v4 dyadic araṃdīśāmata uvikṣa ‘tolerance’; v 99, v2 uvikṣa araṃdīśśāmata, BS upekṣā. ṃElsewhere only anaṃdīśś- with -n- replacing -r-, Ⅲ 5, 12r4 ma anaṃdīśśa ma hāmuri yana ‘do not overlook, do not forget’, Ⅲ 2, 20v4 ma aña yana ma anaṃdīśä ‘ do not act otherwise, do not tolerate’, Z 12.114 anaṃdīśśäte, v 114, 63V2 cīyä rre anaṃdīśśäte ksīrū bvānu o adātu ‘when the king overlooks ruin and injustice in the land’, BS yadā hy upekṣate rājā duṣkṛtam viṣaye sthitaṃ, v115, 64r2 rre anaṃdīśśākä, BS rājā hy upekṣakaḥ ‘neglectful king’.
‘wild (?), K 154.41 cu bura vā yāla arājsa jūṣū kūlą ‘or whatever evil wild things I do to disturb the Vajra-kula’. Taken as adjective to araa-, as khūṇājsa- ‘having holes’.
‘envy’, and arāyä, see s.v. are jsa.

‘wild-natured (?), Manj.108 śera ne yanīda arā-bū ‘(the ignorant) do not do good things, being wild- natured’, taken as araa-buva-. Base ara- ‘wild’, ara-, araa- as first component, to Av. ara-, Oss. ärra ‘wild, mad’ (as the young boy Batraz is called ärra läppu ‘ wild boy’), Sogd. ”r’k *āraka-, IE Pok. 27-8 al- ‘be wild’, see BSOAS 24, 1961, 473, adding possibly Hittite allaniya- ‘ to be restive (horse) ’. The -bū of arā-bū is from bau-: bū- ‘to be’.

‘inflammation’, Sid. 138v2 agvā vī arādā hame ‘ in the limbs inflammation occurs’, BS dāhavant-, Tib. lus ćha- bar byed-pa yino; arāṃdāṃ ‘inflammation’ Ⅰ 185, 105v2 u jsahira arāṃdāṃ jiṃda ‘it removes inflammation in the belly’, BS dāha-śamana-, possibly *arāvantāka- from base ar- ‘to burn’, IE Pok. 28 al-. For –āṃda-, note also urāṃda- ‘pregnant’ from udarāvant-. See also rauḍa-.

‘spotless’, K 62, 76v1 arīmä with variant K 53.9.2 agaṃjsa- ‘faultless’; dyadic Manj.347 arīma, avasve; adj. arrīmajsa- ‘clean’, SuvP. 69r3 arīmajsa, BS nirmala-; v 15, 1b3 ata arrīmajse; v 303, 02b2 vasvetī arrīmajsä ttaraṃdarä himi ‘ he has a pure spotless body (-ī himi ‘is to him’). Base rai-:rī-, see rrīman- ‘dirt’.

‘stinking’, Sid. 153r4 u ariśe’ bauśa hame ‘and bad smell occurs’, BS gūthaka-, Tib. dri mnam-pa yino; Sid. 140v2 arīśai’ va bauśä hame, Tib. kha-dri mi źim-pa ‘mouth smell not pleasant’; Ⅲ 123.61 arīśa’ satta, BS virūpa-satva-; Ⅲ 124.76 thāṃṣ̄ arīśa’ bījaisą., BS ttava vīrupa kathaiyasī ‘you speak ill’. See rrīśą ‘appetite’, BS ruci- ‘desire’, base raiz-.

‘remedy’ plural to aruvā- ‘remedy, medicament’ (with -ū < -va < -vä < -ve); note drabāḍū plural from drabāḍva ‘of the three times’, Manj. 316-17 dāvīje arrū prrabāvna naṣa’mārai harbaiśa sañe ‘by force of the dharma-medicine, all concepts are made quiescent’.
‘not broken’, v 64.42 balaudi ūstānä arūnai hu<.> sidhavaṃdī padīmi ‘I will make him strong, upright, sound, well- .., successful’. From a-rugnaa-, base raug-:rug ‘break’. See narūj-.

‘unafflicted’, K 60, 34V2 khu aśtą biśvā sarva-dharmvā avarūsye ‘so that he is in all dharma-elements unaffected’ (aśtą, not ra śtą); K 6, I45V3 avarrū<ṣy>au (sa)lāvyau ‘with unaffected words’, Tib. hphags-pahi tha-sñad ‘noble talk’, Chin. = BS ārya-caryā; translation E. Lamotte 252 nobles modes de parler. From a- ‘ not’ and parrūṣya- ‘subject affliction’, see parrūṣka-, BS kleśa-.

‘not sent, non-commissioned (?)’, Ⅳ 33b1 śe hvaṃḍye 260 mūri paśā avaśāna ‘for each man 260 mūrā- coins, commissioned, non-commissioned’; Ⅳ 52a2 stūra pajīṃdä paśā avaśāna daśe hvaṃdāṃ ‘they demand stūra-cattle, commissioned, non-commissioned, of ten men’, see SDTV 3; 1123.19.2paśa avaśāna hvaṃḍi himya; Ⅱ 20, 12b2 ttī jsā<ṃ> paśā avaśāna cirāṣṭa ‘then com_x005fmissioned, non-commissioned to Cira’. See paśāta- ‘sent’.
‘plant name’, Ⅲ 90.192, see s.v. rah'i-piṃṇä.

‘studying’ (with locative), Ⅲ 100.9 from abi-ah-, abi-šta- base ah- ‘ throw, put ’ or possibly ah- ‘ to be ’ abi- ah- ‘ be absorbed in’, Orm. aw-, infinitive awōk, and haw-, participle hištak ‘to read’ from abi-ah- and abi-šta-. See the full text s.v. śvrrai.
‘not departing, permanent’, K 148.61-2 pārśa’ pajsaṃ avaṣṭaga caḍāve ‘may he practise continuous wor_x005f_x001f_ship, reverence’. From a- ‘not’ and paṣṭa- ‘depart’.
‘permanent’, Z 11.37 avaṣṭandai ṣī varata parāhä ‘the śīla- (moral rule) is permanent there’; Z 22.313 puña avaṣṭandā yande ‘he makes permanent merits (BS puṇya-)'. To paṣṭa- ‘depart’.
‘not fear, safety’, K 140.997 ava’ste haurākä ‘giver of security’; SuvP. 72r4 ave’sta, BS abhaya-; K 64, 81r2 ave’sta kīthe, abhaiyi-pūrä. See puva’sta- ‘fearing’.
loan-word with -īnaa-, v 183, a4 avastīnai haurna ‘with non-vastu gift’.
‘ non-permanent, incohate’ 1 145, 54r4 cvaṃ avastya vaṣprrīśta ‘for whom the incohate thing dis_x005fperses’. See vastya- s.v. vasta.
‘not pure’, Manj. 347 śe śāmai vasve arīma śe śāme avasve saitta ‘of one mouth the pure seems foul, of one mouth it seems impure’. See vasuta- ‘purified’.

‘pathless’, K 110.338-9 daśau dīśau jsa hāṣṭa baysuña- vuysā ttsvāda avahā ttye baiśa hāṣṭa ‘ from the ten regions the bodhisattvas went there by air into the house’. Rather Prakrit from BS apatha- with -ka- ‘without a path’, hence ‘through the pathless air’. But possibly paθ- as Av.paθō-.
‘unchecked ’, K 50.5.4 raida-pāda tta maṃ hamāṃde avahīyi tvari bījairma ‘may they have the ṛddhi-pādas so, here,unchecked, very excellent’. See pahīya- from pahej-.
‘ lack of base ’, K 68.187, avārihā K 68.213. See pārahā.
‘unbased’, Ⅲ 24, 20a3 avārauttä aysmū, BS apratiṣṭhitam cittaṃ, K 60,38r2 avārāṃtta-; Manj. 149 avārātta. See pārautta-.
‘no deficiency’, SuvO. 53r3, BS avaikalyatā. See vārūḍya-.
‘inconceivable ’, SuvP. 70VI ttiṣṭīmä kalpa avāṣṭa, BS tiṣṭheya kalpāni adntiyāni ‘ may I persist through inconceiv_x005f_x001f_able kalpa-ages ’. See akāṣṭa- from käṣ-: kāṣṭa- ‘ to think ’.
‘not seeing, blind’, fem., v 387.48 avījsyaca strrīya ‘blind woman’; K 46.37 ttye avijsyace strrīyi jsahera ‘in the womb of that blind woman’.

‘blind’, masc., JS 3IV3-4 avījsyamdā ysāḍaka dva mārā-pyara ‘ blind two old parents ’; K 46.47 pūra avījsyadai ysā ‘the son was born blind’; K 47.54 ṣi’ avījsyade ṣīrka ‘ the blind child’; Manj. 9 hana avījsyadai satva ‘blind, not seeing, being’ (dyadic). See vijsäṣ-.

‘not speaking’, v 343, 85v2 samu avätāye- mate jsa āre ‘they sit silent’, BS G 37, 80a3 tūṣṇīṃ-bhāvena-adhivāsayanti, Tib. čaŋ mi smra-bar hkhod-pa, be_x005f_x001f_side v 343,85v5 samu apätāyāme jsa, BS G 37,80a6 tūṣṇīṃ-bhāvena-adhivāsayanti. See avyāya, to pätāy- ‘to speak’,
‘invisible (?) ’, K 60, 37V4 ne śaṃdya paremāṇavyā avīmeṃ jsāte ‘ does not go invisibly into the earth with the atoms’. See āvīda, to base vai-(n)- ‘to see’.

‘stoneless (?)’, 11 66.2-3 ttye pracaina cä bugura maṃdūsäna śaṃdā gärye avīmya gaṃtsa kūḍai vīra ‘ because Bugura bought land from Maṃdūsa, stoneless (?), with hole (and) pit’. See bīma- ‘rock, stone’, Av.vaēma-,Parth. Insc. vēm, Armen, vēm. See s.v. kūṣḍa-; SDTV 58.

‘best’, K 66, 84v3 ba’ysūśtä bautta avīrmā- ttama hvāṣṭä ‘he realizes the supreme excellent bodhi-knowledge’; K 59, 33r4 ttye käṇą mī byāṃdāṃdi tvā avīrmāttame ra(ṣṭa) ba’ysāna ba’ysūśtą, biśvā sarva-dharmā bīysāṃda ‘therefore they got that supreme Buddhas’ bodhi-knowledge awakened in all dharma-elements’; II 102.23 avīrmāttama be’ysāna be’ysūś’tä bausta hamye hamau-manai ‘may we become awakened to the best Buddhas’ bodhi-knowledge’, rendering BS anuttara-. See pīrmā-ttama- ‘best’.

‘undivided’, v 265, Dum 7b3 u aväṣkälstu pra-täha///; Ⅲ134,3a5 aväṣkälsto hīśäḍośtu därysde; K 57,26r1 aviṣkesta lakṣaṇä; K 60,36v4 vasva aviṣkesta lakṣaṇa; K145, 3r3-4 avaiṣkesta(-ṣk-, not -sk-). See päṣkal- ‘to separate’. avīsadai‘not returning’, =BS avaivartika-, anāgāmin-, Ⅲ 113, 4r3; K 92-48. See atīsandaa-, iīsedai.
‘not returning’, =BS avaivartika-, anāgāmin-, Ⅲ 113, 4r3; K 92.48. See atīsandaa-, iīsedai.

‘priceless’, JS 33r4 phare raṃne avīha’ ‘many price_x005f_x001f_less jewels’, JS I4Ⅱ avīhyau ramnyo ‘with priceless jewels’; Ⅲ 58.16 avīhä:, BS anargha-. See pīha- ‘price’, BS mūlya-, and āra- ‘value’.

‘unchecked’, K 59, 3IV4 ba’ysuñavuysai asaṃkhistä ṣṭe avihī ‘the bodhisattva is untouched (unsmeared), un_x005fchecked’; K 58, 28r3 varī aysmūtī anāvidhyāyi hame avīhī ‘on the spot his mind becomes untouched, un_x001f_checked’. See pahej-:pahīya- ‘to stop’, ipihī.

‘not overcome’, K 153-22 māryau jsa avurrdą ‘ not overcome by Māras ’ = BS ajita-; K 52.7.3 avaurrdä; v 107, 29v3 avurde īsāre ‘they withdraw without con_x005f_x001f_quest’, BS pramathaka- ‘repulser’; v 113, 35Ⅱ avurda hämāre ‘they are unconquered’, BS anavamardita-. See purr-:purrda- ‘to fight’.
‘unafraid’, v 41, a4 avuva’sta tsīnd<ä> ‘they go safely’. See puva’sta- ‘fearful’.

‘unheroic (?)’, Ⅲ 104-34 kṣūna mauḍū naradū avai’danya nairamāna ma vāṃ sāṣṭā ‘dying of hunger I went out feeling unheroic (?); in going out I (fem.) looked (=spāṣṭā) upon you here(=mara vā-ū)’. From the context and from possible connexion with vad- ‘to thrust’ in Oss. bädän- in DI. bädäjnag ‘heroic (man, woman, horse)’ from ‘impetuous’, with Oss. bädän ‘membrum virile’, base vad- in Av. vādāya-.
‘lack of fear’, K 64, 8Ⅳ2 avesta kīthe, abhaiyi-pūrä ‘in the city of safety’, dyadic; K 29.183-4 khu ra parśta avesta ‘so that he escape unafraid’. See avuva’sta, avasta-, from puva’d-.
‘intolerable’, Ⅲ 106.24, see avyauca-.
‘speechless’, Manj. 415-16 pyāstāda avyāya satva ‘the dumb beings spoke’, variant Z 5-101 u muta pätāstu yäḍāndä ‘and the dumb could speak’. See pätāy-.
‘not speaking’, JS 18v3 nvastä avyāyaṃdai buy’sä ‘he lay silent long time’. See pätāy-.
‘not speaking’, Ⅲ 60.36-7 avyāyāme jsa simāhāṃ vī ṇe’stä ‘he sat without speaking in a samādhāna- trance’. See avätāyemate jsa, from pätāy- ‘to speak’.

‘not stated’, Ⅲ 28, 38b3-4 jaḍa haḍa ṣṭā kūra māsāre avyāsta ṣa’ dharma mūkhau jsa jaḍau prahajañau jsa (hvata ?) ‘however the ignorant (BS jaḍa-) accept the false things, not spoken; this is stated as dharma-doctrine by fools (BS mūrkha-) by ignorant laymen’, BS sa ca bāla- prthagjanair udgṛhītaḥ; Ⅲ 28, 39a3-4 ttina gyasta ba’ysäna hvata avyāstä dharma jaḍyau prahujañau jsa hvata ‘the dharma-doctrine, not taught, spoken by the deva Buddha is stated by the ignorant laymen to be false’. To pätāsta-; = BS anirvacanīya- ‘ineffable’.
‘not heard’, K 1, I35v2 ne avyūṣṭu pyūṣḍe ‘hears not the unheard’; Z 2 -117 niśtä avyūṣṭä adäte avaysāndäkari ‘is not unheard, unseen, unknown at all’. See apyūṣṭa-.

‘intolerable, severe’, Sid. 12r5 ttarä hīvī āchai avyauca na’heje ‘removes the intolerable disease of thirst’, Tib. skom-pahi nad mi bzad-pa źi-bar byed-de (elsewhere Tib. mi bzad-pa renders BS dāruṇa-); Sid. 100r3-4 dvyā kve’ysvā vī avyauca vīna himāre ‘ in both sides severe pains occur’; K 31.27 avyauca baida āvūṃ mar a ṣṭānä pahaiyi ‘ (taxes) intolerable were laid on them, from here, they fled’, =K 15.117 ttaña kṣīra daura(ba)kṣa pasta tvara avyaucha ‘in the country famine occurred exceedingly severe’, =K 23.72-3 avatca vī āva bīhī kīḍa bara jasta skadaka śā śā mara ṣṭāna pahaiya ‘ (taxes) were laid on them, intolerable exceedingly, O king, one by one they fled hence secretly’. Also avyāca, Ⅲ 106.24 tta brīvīnai be-vūḍa pūna ysaira baida baista avyāca ‘ so love’s poisoned arrows intolerable pierced the heart’, see SDTV 30; Ⅱ 40.36-7 dakhu kāra avyāca baye haysgama ‘misery, tor_x005f_x001f_ment (BS kāraṇa-), intolerable fear, grief’. Without negative Ⅱ 2.19 haṃdarāṃ jsāṃ vyaucą yanīdą. ‘they make tolerable to others’. See pyauea ‘counter-action, remedy’ for the connexions.

aśa-‘horse’, V 115, 64V2 aśśa märāre ‘horses die’, BS mṛtābhikṣṇaṃ priyāśvāś ca; Sid. I02v5 aśä ‘horse’, Tib. rta; v 236.23 aśa salya ‘in the Horse year’.
